item.description: The article discusses the risks associated with AI-powered notetaking tools, highlighting the potential for sensitive data breaches and privacy issues. It emphasizes the importance of careful implementation, secure storage, and robust access controls to mitigate these risks.

item.title: Pure Crypter Uses Multiple Evasion Methods to Bypass Windows 11 24H2 Security Features
item.description: Pure Crypter is a malware-as-a-service (MaaS) loader used by threat actors to deploy information stealers like Lumma and Rhadamanthys. It has demonstrated adaptability in evading Microsoft's security enhancements in Windows 11 24H2, including bypassing Process Hollowing-based injection using a patch of the NtManageHotPatch API in memory.

item.title: New EDDIESTEALER Malware Bypasses Chrome's App-Bound Encryption to Steal Browser Data
item.description: A novel Rust-based information stealer dubbed EDDIESTEALER is distributed using the ClickFix social engineering tactic, compromising legitimate websites with malicious JavaScript payloads that prompt site visitors to execute a PowerShell script, ultimately deploying the infostealer. The malware harvests sensitive data such as credentials, browser information, and cryptocurrency wallet details.

item.title: Attackers Exploit Microsoft Entra Billing Roles to Escalate Privileges
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft Entra ID; CVE(s): None; Summary: A critical security gap in Microsoft Entra B2B guest accounts allows external guest users to gain powerful control over Azure environments by leveraging billing roles and creating new subscriptions without explicit administrative privileges. This behavior is not a software bug but rather an architectural design choice, enabling guests to spin up new subscriptions and move them into target tenants, opening potential attack vectors for attackers who become subscription Owners.

item.title: Getting Exposure Management Right: Insights from 500 CISOs
item.description:
Vulnerable Product: None; Summary: The article discusses the importance of exposure management in cybersecurity, highlighting the growing complexity of attack surfaces and the need for a strategic approach to managing vulnerabilities. It also emphasizes the need for prioritizing exposures based on their impact rather than solely focusing on exploitability.
FYSA: The article provides insights from Pentera's 4th Pentesting report, which reveals that despite increased pentesting efforts, attackers are still able to breach systems. It highlights the importance of exposure management in reducing cyber risk and emphasizes the need for a proactive approach to managing vulnerabilities.

item.title: Microsoft Reveals Techniques for Defending Against Evolving AiTM Attacks
item.description: This article highlights the escalating sophistication of phishing attacks, particularly focusing on Adversary-in-the-Middle (AiTM) techniques. It emphasizes the importance of adopting phishing-resistant, passwordless authentication methods like passkeys, complementing MFA with risk-based Conditional Access policies, and user awareness training to recognize social engineering lures.

item.title: Top 10 Dark Web Markets
item.description: The article discusses the top 10 dark web markets, highlighting their features, categories, and user bases. These markets facilitate the trade of illegal goods and services, including drugs, stolen data, malware, and counterfeit documents. Despite frequent law enforcement takedowns and exit scams, new platforms continue to emerge with stronger security measures, making it harder to shut them down entirely. The article also highlights SOCRadar's Dark Web Report, which scans various sources to identify mentions of a company, employees, or assets on the dark web.

item.title: Critical Icinga 2 Vulnerability Allows Attackers to Obtain Valid Certificates
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Icinga 2; CVE(s): CVE-2025-48057; Summary: A critical vulnerability in Icinga 2's VerifyCertificate() function allows attackers to obtain valid certificates from the Icinga Certificate Authority, potentially impersonating trusted nodes and compromising monitoring environments. The flaw affects installations built with OpenSSL versions older than 1.1.0.

item.title: Hackers Use Gh0st RAT to Hijack Internet Café Systems for Crypto Mining
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Korean Internet café management programs; CVE(s): None; Summary: Hackers have been targeting internet cafés in South Korea since 2022, exploiting specialized management software to install malicious tools for cryptocurrency mining. The attackers use Gh0st RAT and its droppers to seize control of systems and deploy the T-Rex CoinMiner to mine cryptocurrencies like Ethereum and RavenCoin.

item.title: Windows 11 Security Update for 22H2 & 23H2 May Cause Recovery Errors
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Windows 11; CVE(s): None; Summary: The KB5058405 security update has caused significant boot failures in some users running Windows 11 versions 22H2 and 23H2, especially in enterprise and virtual environments. Affected systems display a recovery error with code 0xc0000098 referencing the ACPI.sys file, which is essential for power management and device configuration.

item.title: New Study Uncovers Multiple Vulnerabilities in WeChat and IM Apps
item.description: Vulnerable Product: WeChat; CVE(s): CVE-2019-11932, CVE-2023-41064, CVE-2023-4863; Summary: A single WeChat message can be leveraged for persistent client-side attacks. Attackers can exploit lax URL validation to craft malicious links, and file processing vulnerabilities allow remote code execution. Additionally, built-in browser components, such as the XWEB engine, are vulnerable to known issues like CVE-2023-41064 and CVE-2023-4863 in the libwebp component.

item.title: MICI NetFax Server Flaws Allow Attackers to Execute Remote Code
item.description: Vulnerable Product: MICI Network Co., Ltd's NetFax Server; CVE(s): CVE-2025-48045, CVE-2025-48046, and CVE-2025-48047; Summary: The NetFax Server has three severe vulnerabilities allowing attackers to gain root-level access through a chain of authenticated attacks. The flaws include default administrative credentials exposed in cleartext, stored SMTP passwords exposed, and improper input sanitization leading to remote code execution as the root user.

item.title: China-Linked Hackers Exploit SAP and SQL Server Flaws in Attacks Across Asia and Brazil
item.description: Vulnerable Product: SAP NetWeaver; CVE(s): CVE-2025-31324; Summary: The article discusses a critical unauthenticated file upload vulnerability in SAP NetWeaver (CVE-2025-31324) exploited by the China-linked threat actor Earth Lamia. The vulnerability allows attackers to establish a reverse shell and gain control of infrastructure under their control.

item.title: Hackers Use AI-Generated Videos on TikTok to Spread Info-Stealing Malware
item.description: Cybercriminals are exploiting TikTok to distribute information-stealing malware, using AI-generated videos posing as tutorials for unlocking pirated software. The campaign uses social engineering and advanced technology like AI to trick unsuspecting viewers into executing malicious PowerShell commands, leading to the download of malware strains such as Vidar and StealC.

item.title: Dark Web Profile: NightSpire Ransomware
item.description: Vulnerable Product: NightSpire Ransomware; CVE(s): CVE-2024-55591; Summary: NightSpire is a financially motivated ransomware group that employs double extortion tactics, encrypting data after exfiltration. They target small to medium-sized enterprises across multiple industries and countries, exploiting public-facing vulnerabilities like CVE-2024-55591.

item.title: From the "Department of No" to a "Culture of Yes": A Healthcare CISO's Journey to Enabling Modern Care
item.description: The article discusses the challenges faced by healthcare organizations in balancing security requirements with the need for frictionless care delivery. It highlights the importance of integrating security and IT operations to enable a culture of yes, where security is no longer seen as a barrier but rather an enabler of modern healthcare.

item.title: Weaponized PyPI Package Executes Supply Chain Attack to Steal Solana Private Keys
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Python Package Index (PyPI); CVE(s): None; Summary: A malicious package named semantic-types was discovered in PyPI, which deploys a covert key-stealing payload targeting Solana blockchain developers. The attack leverages a backdoor that silently exfiltrates private keys, posing a severe risk to developer environments and CI/CD pipelines.

item.title: Novel Malware Evades Detection by Skipping PE Header in Windows
item.description: Researchers have identified a new strain of malware that bypasses traditional detection mechanisms by omitting the Portable Executable (PE) header in Windows environments. This innovative evasion tactic makes many signature-based and heuristic analysis tools ineffective, allowing the malware to load its malicious payload directly into memory without relying on a structured PE header.

item.title: Safari Flaw Exploited by BitM Attack to Steal User Login Data
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Multiple (browser-agnostic); CVE(s): None; Summary: A new type of phishing attack, known as Fullscreen Browser-in-the-Middle (BitM) attacks, uses the Fullscreen API to create convincing overlays that mask browser interface elements, making malicious activity nearly undetectable. The attack works by tricking users into clicking a malicious link or button, which triggers a remote browser session and allows attackers to capture credentials and sensitive data.

item.title: Next.js Dev Server Vulnerability Leads to Developer Data Exposure
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Next.js; CVE(s): CVE-2025-48068; Summary: The Next.js framework has a vulnerability (CVE-2025-48068) that allows attackers to exploit the development server via Cross-site WebSocket Hijacking (CSWSH), exposing sensitive application source code. The issue is fixed in version 15.2.2, but developers must upgrade and configure their environments securely to mitigate the risk of similar exploits.

item.title: Critical Cisco IOS XE Flaw Permits Arbitrary File Upload — PoC Released
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Cisco; CVE(s): CVE-2025-20188; Summary: A critical vulnerability in Cisco IOS XE Wireless LAN Controllers (WLCs) allows unauthenticated remote attackers to upload arbitrary files and potentially execute commands as root, granting full control over affected devices. The flaw arises from a hard-coded JSON Web Token (JWT) used in the Out-of-Band AP Image Download feature.

item.title: North Korean IT Workers Exploit Legitimate Software and Network Tactics to Evade EDR
item.description: A North Korean IT worker infiltrated a Western organization using a remote-control system that exploited legitimate software and network protocols. The attacker used WebSockets for C2 communication and ARP packets for decentralized command propagation, making it difficult to detect with traditional EDR systems.

item.title: New Rust-Based InfoStealer Uses Fake CAPTCHA to Deliver EDDIESTEALER
item.description: A newly discovered infostealer, EDDIESTEALER, is spreading through social engineering tactics involving fake CAPTCHA verification pages. The malware, built in Rust, steals sensitive data such as credentials, browser information, and cryptocurrency wallet details by executing PowerShell scripts on Windows systems.

item.title: U.S. Sanctions Funnull for $200M Romance Baiting Scams Tied to Crypto Fraud
item.description: The article discusses a Philippines-based company, Funnull Technology Inc., and its administrator Liu Lizhi, who were sanctioned by the U.S. Department of Treasury's Office of Foreign Assets Control (OFAC) for providing infrastructure to conduct romance baiting scams that led to massive cryptocurrency losses.

item.title: ConnectWise Hit by Advanced Cyberattack: Internal Data at Risk
item.description: Vulnerable Product: ConnectWise ScreenConnect; CVE(s): CVE-2025-3935; Summary: A critical vulnerability (CVE-2025-3935) was exploited by a nation-state actor to execute remote code via ViewState code injection, leveraging unsafe deserialization in the ASP.NET framework. The vulnerability allowed attackers with privileged system-level access to execute arbitrary code on the server, and was fixed with the release of version 25.2.4.

item.title: Apache Tomcat CGI Servlet Flaw Enables Security Constraint Bypass
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Apache Software Foundation Apache Tomcat; CVE(s): CVE-2025-46701; Summary: A vulnerability in Apache Tomcat's CGI servlet (CVE-2025-46701) allows attackers to bypass security constraints by manipulating the case of characters in the pathInfo portion of a URL, potentially granting unauthorized access to restricted CGI resources.

item.title: SentinelOne Recovers: Platform Back Online After Extended Outage
item.description: SentinelOne experienced a significant platform outage that disrupted access to its commercial customer consoles worldwide, affecting the Management Console and managed response services. The incident was caused by a technical issue within the platform's infrastructure, not a cyberattack or security breach.

item.title: ConnectWise Hit by Cyberattack; Nation-State Actor Suspected in Targeted Breach
item.description: Vulnerable Product: ConnectWise; CVE(s): None; Summary: The article discusses a reported cyber attack on ConnectWise's ScreenConnect software that may have been perpetrated by a nation-state threat actor. While the exact details are unclear, the company has engaged Google Mandiant for forensic analysis and notified affected customers.

item.title: Meta Disrupts Influence Ops Targeting Romania, Azerbaijan, and Taiwan with Fake Personas
item.description: Meta disrupted three covert influence operations originating from Iran, China, and Romania during Q1 2025. The campaigns targeted various platforms, including Meta's services, TikTok, X, and YouTube, using fake accounts, off-platform websites, and AI-generated profile photos. Threat actors leveraged proxy IP infrastructure to conceal their origin and coordination, posting content related to news, current events, and politics.

item.title: U.S. Sanctions Cloud Provider ‘Funnull’ as Top Source of ‘Pig Butchering’ Scams
item.description: The U.S. government imposed sanctions on Funnull Technology Inc., a Philippines-based company, for facilitating virtual currency investment scams known as "pig butchering," resulting in over $200 million in financial losses to Americans.

item.title: Mozilla releases Firefox 139.0.1 update to fix artifacts on Nvidia GPUs
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Mozilla Firefox; CVE(s): None; Summary: Firefox 139.0.1 update fixes graphical artifacts caused by re-enabled DirectComposition path behavior in Firefox 139, which exposed a graphics driver bug on NVIDIA cards under Windows 10, resulting in flickering or flashing videos and webpages. The issue was caused by the removal of a block list that prevented Firefox from using DirectComposition on mixed-refresh NVIDIA setups.

item.title: Microsoft Authenticator now warns to export passwords before July cutoff
item.description: Microsoft Authenticator app is deprecating its password autofill feature, prompting users to export their saved passwords or switch to Microsoft Edge. The change will occur in July 2025, with a gradual phase-out starting June 2025 for saving new passwords and ending August 2025 for accessing saved passwords.

item.title: ZDI-25-311: (Pwn2Own) Sonos Era 300 Heap-based Buffer Overflow Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Sonos Era 300; CVE(s): CVE-2025-1051; Summary: This vulnerability allows network-adjacent attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected Sonos Era 300 speakers without authentication. The specific flaw exists within the processing of ALAC data due to a lack of proper validation of user-supplied data length prior to copying it to a heap-based buffer.

item.title: ZDI-25-310: Linux Kernel ksmbd Session Setup Null Pointer Dereference Denial-of-Service Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Linux Kernel; CVE(s): ZDI-25-310, ZDI-CAN-26505; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to create a denial-of-service condition on affected installations of Linux Kernel by dereferencing a null pointer in the handling of preauth hashes. Authentication is not required to exploit this vulnerability, but only systems with ksmbd enabled are vulnerable.

item.title: ConnectWise breached in cyberattack linked to nation-state hackers
item.description: Vulnerable Product: ConnectWise ScreenConnect; CVE(s): CVE-2025-3935; Summary: A high-severity ViewState code injection bug (CVE-2025-3935) allowed threat actors with privileged system-level access to steal secret machine keys, enabling remote code execution on the server.

item.title: Threat Actors Exploit Nifty[.]com Infrastructure in Sophisticated Phishing Attack
item.description: Threat actors have orchestrated a multi-wave phishing campaign between April and May 2025, leveraging the legitimate infrastructure of Nifty[.]com, a prominent Japanese Internet Service Provider (ISP), to execute their attacks. The campaign used trusted domains, abusing free consumer accounts on Nifty[.]com, and employed various techniques such as HTML padding, display name spoofing, and flawless AI-generated grammar to evade traditional filters. The attack highlights the limitations of legacy email security systems and underscores the need for advanced behavioral analysis and anomaly detection to combat sophisticated phishing attempts.

item.title: A new author has appeared
item.description: None, as this is not an article about a vulnerability or cybersecurity-relevant content. The article appears to be a newsletter introduction by a cybersecurity analyst who has recently joined Cisco Talos and discusses their background in anthropology and technical writing. They also provide information on emerging threats and offer insights into the human side of cybersecurity.

item.title: PureHVNC RAT Uses Fake Job Offers and PowerShell to Evade Security Defenses
item.description: A new malware campaign delivering the PureHVNC Remote Access Trojan (RAT) has been identified by Netskope Threat Labs. The campaign leverages fake job offers and advanced technical evasion methods to bypass security defenses, resulting in full system access for attackers.

item.title: Interlock Ransomware Uses NodeSnake RAT for Persistent Access to Corporate Networks
item.description: NodeSnake, a Remote Access Trojan (RAT), has been used to compromise two UK-based universities. The malware, likely operated by the ransomware group Interlock, demonstrates advanced capabilities for persistent access and network infiltration, including long-term persistence, system reconnaissance, and remote command execution.

item.title: Threat actors abuse Google Apps Script in evasive phishing attacks
item.description: Threat actors are using the "Google Apps Script" development platform to host phishing pages that appear legitimate and steal login credentials. The phishing pages are designed to look like a legitimate login screen, and the attackers use email masquerading as an invoice to trick recipients into handing over sensitive information.

item.title: Apple Safari exposes users to fullscreen browser-in-the-middle attacks
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Apple Safari; CVE(s): None; Summary: A weakness in Apple's Safari web browser allows threat actors to exploit the fullscreen browser-in-the-middle (BitM) technique, making guardrails less visible and tricking users into typing sensitive data in an attacker-controlled window. The attack abuses the Fullscreen API, which is not properly alerted to users on Safari, unlike Firefox and Chromium-based browsers.

item.title: Cybercriminals Target AI Users with Malware-Loaded Installers Posing as Popular Tools
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Various AI tools (OpenAI ChatGPT, InVideo AI, and others); CVE(s): None; Summary: Fake installers for popular AI tools are being used as lures to propagate various threats, including CyberLock ransomware, Lucky_Gh0$t ransomware, and Numero malware. The fake installers claim to offer free access to the tool for the first year, with a monthly subscription of $95 thereafter.

item.title: US sanctions firm linked to cyber scams behind $200 million in losses
item.description: The U.S. Treasury Department has sanctioned Funnull Technology, a Philippines-based company, and its administrator Liu Lizhi for facilitating virtual currency investment scams linked to over $200 million in losses for Americans. The company is responsible for generating numerous unique domain names and providing hosting services to cybercriminals, enabling them to host malicious websites.

item.title: Apache InLong JDBC Vulnerability Enables Deserialization of Untrusted Data
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Apache InLong; CVE(s): CVE-2025-27522; Summary: A moderate-severity vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2025-27522, allows threat actors to bypass security mechanisms in the InLong JDBC component, potentially leading to unauthorized data manipulation or information disclosure. The vulnerability occurs when the system fails to validate or sanitize incoming serialized objects, allowing attackers to craft malicious payloads that can trigger unintended behaviors such as arbitrary file reading or code execution.

item.title: Cybercriminals exploit AI hype to spread ransomware, malware
item.description:
Threat actors are using AI tools as lures to infect victims with malicious payloads, including a PowerShell-based ransomware called CyberLock and a new malware named Numero. The malware is delivered via fake AI tool websites and can encrypt files or render Windows systems unusable.
FYSA: Threat actors linked to lesser-known ransomware and malware projects are now using AI tools as lures to infect unsuspecting victims with malicious payloads, including info-stealer malware operators and ransomware operations attempting to breach corporate networks.

item.title: Criminal IP Set to Make Its Debut at Infosecurity Europe 2025
item.description: The article announces Criminal IP's participation in Infosecurity Europe 2025, a major cybersecurity conference in Europe. The platform will showcase its AI-powered threat intelligence solutions and engage with security professionals to accelerate its entry into the European market.

item.title: Attackers are mapping your attack surface—are you?
item.description: The article discusses the importance of Attack Surface Management (ASM) in understanding an organization's digital footprint. It highlights how attackers use ASM to map out a target's infrastructure, and emphasizes the need for defenders to do the same to stay secure. The article promotes Sprocket Security's ASM tool as a solution to provide visibility into an attack surface, prioritize exposure by real-world risk, and close gaps before adversaries exploit them.

item.title: Windows 11 File Explorer Vulnerability Enables NTLM Hash Theft
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft Windows; CVE(s): CVE-2025-24071; Summary: A vulnerability in Windows File Explorer allows attackers to capture NTLM authentication hashes by tricking users into extracting a malicious ZIP archive. The flaw exploits Windows Explorer's automatic file processing and can be exploited to gain access to networks for lateral movement or offline cracking of NTLM hashes.
